result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L. Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew L. Jenkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew L. Jenkins was found guilty of Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentenced to 10 years WI State Prison. 5 years initial confinement with 5 years extended supervision.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew L. Jenkins in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Matthew L. Jenkins in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter was set due to the court receiving a request to clarify the DNA surcharge.
Atty Gumz responds and states that his client did not get the letter regarding the surcharge.  Atty Gumz has spoke with his client and his client understands the surcharge needing to be in added.

BY THE COURT:  JOC to be amended to add the $250 DNA Surcharge and DNA Sample (if not done so already).
for Writ of Habeas Corpus s/BNB/1-17-17

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Matthew L. Jenkins
Current: PO BOx 147, Fox Lake Correctional - DOC #488134, Fox Lake, WI 53933 United States  (Effective: 01-11-2017)
Prior: 403 Jackson Street, Portage, WI 53901
Telephone conference on January 4, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Telephone conference on December 21, 2016 at 09:15 am.
transcript of plea & sentencing hearing held on 4/23/15 - Karen Blari, reporter

Defendant Matthew L. Jenkins in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Matthew L. Jenkins in custody.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF104 & 14CF105 tracking together:
  Atty Gumz states plea agreement to 14CF104 & Ct. 1 in 14CF105.  Ct. 2 will be dismissed.  Atty Bonnett agrees with that agreement; however, Ct. 2 would be dismissed and read-in.
  State has complied with victim notification requirements and gives the court a victim impact statement in which the court reads.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of 14CF104 & Ct. 1 in 14CF105.  Ct. 2 will be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Bonnett makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  14CF104:  Court orders 10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 5 years Initial Confinement and 5 years Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to any other sentence that the defendant is currently serving
Court Costs = $268
Restitution = $2,360.28 + surcharge = $2,596.30
Payment to be made throughout the defendant's sentence
Comply with and complete any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Substance Abuse Program if eligible


14CF105:  Court orders 10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 5 years Initial Confinement and 5 years Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to 14CF104 and any other sentence that the defendant is currently serving.
Court Costs = $268.00
Restitution = $388.00 + surcharge = $426.80
Payment to be made throughout the defendant's sentence
Comply with and complete any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Substance Abuse Program if eligible
Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Court advises defendant of DNA Sample requirement per statute.
Return date on April 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew L. Jenkins in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Matthew L. Jenkins in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz states defendant is waiving the preliminary hearing at this time.  Court questions defendant as to the waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver entered freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Atty Hendee states he will be filing an Information with the same charges as in the complaint within 30 days.  Atty Gumz enteres Not Guilty plea.
BY THE OCURT:  Set for return.  Return date scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on February 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
